articles.title: 1932 - An Athenian Moves Objects from a Distance
articles.excerpt: Report on the telekinetic abilities of the Athenian medium Kleio Georgiou under the supervision of Tanagras.

content.value: Paradox Phenomena
Athens (from our correspondent)

Recently the Hellenic Society of Psychophysiology, directed by Mr. Angelos Tanagras, discovered an exceptional telekinetic medium—a young Athenian woman with the strange gift of moving objects from afar without touching them.

What is curious and worth studying in these phenomena is whether the medium can produce them at will. Without wanting to, such paradoxical mediums make odd displacements of objects, breakages, and so on, usually when everyone’s attention is elsewhere. The phenomena are normally noticed only by their results. Experiments are now being done to see if they can occur deliberately and in front of others. Such tests were recently carried out by the Hellenic Society of Psychophysiology with the newly revealed medium.

This polite young woman, who proved to be an excellent medium, is the daughter of a distinguished Athenian family, with fine upbringing, appearing under the pseudonym Kleio Georgiou. After a severe mental shock—losing her beloved father and sister at the same time—telekinetic phenomena began around her. Objects often left one room and appeared in another or turned up under other items, and so many similar incidents.

Mr. A. Tanagras asked the young lady, thanks to whose hidden powers these things happened, to try at set times to move objects without touching them. The attempt was to move a nautical compass and little spheres sealed beneath a metal bell. Miss Kleio tried persistently for many days and, as Mr. Tanagras confirmed, finally managed to move the compass needle.

A small compass was set in front of her on a table. Miss Kleio held her hands open over it and moved them right and left up to a span away, focusing her thought. After a few moments she managed to swing the compass needle without touching it up to 90 degrees—one quarter of the circle. This was repeated many times. At points she even turned the needle through a full circle.

Then Mr. Tanagras asked her to put her hands under the table. The result was the same. When Kleio moved her hands to place her fingers under the table, the needle again made full circles. Afterwards the compass was placed under two glass covers; once more the result was the same, sometimes equally strong, sometimes weaker.

These truly astonishing phenomena, once checked and confirmed, were repeated with a wider circle of people during the Society’s sessions for telepathy experiments between Athens and London, which we have already described.

Mr. Tanagras then explained the great importance of the phenomenon and asked those present to try to do what Miss Kleio did. Naturally no one succeeded. The courteous young woman, for the sake of scientific verification, asked the hostess of the house where the experiments were held to search and examine her.
Part 1

articles.title: 1932 - Medium Zoe Voudouri - Certificate & Allagi Newspaper
articles.excerpt: Announcement about the medium Zoe Voudouri, showing hypnotic over-intensity and telepathy. Readers of the newspaper Allagi can submit two questions with five issues; answers will appear in a dedicated column.

content.value: The scientific world and educated society are astonished by the unprecedented phenomenon of the young medium Zoe Voudouri. This medium has signed a special contract to take part every coming Monday in spiritualist sessions for the readers of Allagi, inside its offices.
Any reader of Allagi who brings five issues of the paper is entitled to ask two questions related to their affairs, etc.
What Mr. Tanagras says about the new medium
HELLENIC SOCIETY OF PSYCHOPHYSIOLOGY - CERTIFICATE
It is certified that ZOE VOUDOURI presents the following exceptional phenomena:
a) Hypnosis of post-spiritual over-intensity
b) Hypnosis and post-hypnotic suggestion
c) Telepathy
This certificate is issued to serve her before the Authorities and local Medical and Scientific Associations.
President A. Tanagras
For the provinces
Readers will cut the dates of ten consecutive issues of Allagi, hand the issues to the Press Agency in their city, and receive a receipt.
They will place that receipt in an envelope along with the issue dates they submitted and their two questions, signing the letter with a pseudonym or initials.
The answer will be given in the relevant column of the newspaper.

articles.title: 1959 - Advertisement for Medium Elpida Pavlatou
articles.excerpt: Elpida Pavlatou received an award for long-distance telepathy from the GSPR. Experiments with scientific backing were conducted with international societies. She receives daily at 6 Kritis Street, Athens.

content.value: Diploma and Long-Distance Telepathy Award of the Society for Psychical Research for her exceptional performance in experiments conducted by Mr. Tanagras and the foreign societies of Vienna, Tuebingen, London, New York, with professors Gardener Murphy and Esterreich. She also demonstrated psychometry phenomena.
Performs all experiments with scientific basis. Receives daily 9 a.m.–1 p.m. and 4–7 p.m. at 6 Kritis Street, off Liosion Street, Plateia Vathis.

articles.title: 1963 - Advertisement Diplomatic Medium of the Psychophysiological Society
articles.excerpt: Spiritualist services for relationships, predictions, disappearances. Scientific horoscope by birth date. Letters with return stamp to Mrs. Toulan T., 14 Patision, 7th floor, Athens.

content.value: Effective psycho-spiritual experiments at any distance. Answers whatever concerns you: all kinds of relationships, marriage, nervous issues, predictions, disappearances, the dead, lost objects, etc. Suggestions, autosuggestion, distant influence through psychobolia under hypnosis. Also learn the course of your life through a scientific horoscope prepared from your birth date and year. For letters from Greece and abroad, send a reply stamp. To Mrs. Toulan T., 14 Patision Street, 7th floor.
Athens

articles.title: A New Medium - Miss Dafni 1940
articles.author: Angelos Tanagras
articles.excerpt: The GSPR presents the new medium Dafni.

image.alt: Dafni – new medium of the Society for Psychical Research

content.value: For years one of our best pythias, Mrs. Pavlatou, brought her little niece to the Society. About ten years old, blond, a doll that everyone admired and patted on the head.
…And suddenly, one day a cloud fell over our circle: the news that the beautiful Greek doll was gravely ill with meningitis.

What she suffered and how she survived is not the point. The important thing is that she survived. And with her recovery another interesting phenomenon appeared. It happens sometimes in people with heredity that after brain illnesses, intuitive qualities appear: telepathy, clairvoyance, etc.

In this case heredity existed, since on her mother’s side her aunt is one of the best Greek pythias. The irritation of the meninges did the rest. The little doll began to show strong signs of her talent.
And what a coincidence! Daphne was one of the finest ancient pythias of the Delphic Oracle.

Naturally, as soon as her health was restored, she joined the circle of intuitives of the Society for Psychical Research and her training began. Today her gift has developed enough to handle the public safely. Last year she already took part in long-distance telepathy experiments with England and Germany, ranking among the first; Professor Esterreich of Tuebingen University and Mr. Herbert, director of the experiments of the English Society for Psychical Research, underlined her success.
The Society for Psychical Research presents her gladly, happy that the blood and sacred tradition of the ancient pythias have not yet dried up in our people.

articles.title: Trial after a Medium’s Revelations - 1934
articles.excerpt: Court of Appeal case where the culprits of a suitcase theft were found thanks to medium Mrs. Zakynthinou—Tanagras explained the phenomenon as thought-transference.

image.alt: Trial after revelations of a medium

content.value: A trial on revelations from a medium.
In Greece, thanks to the GSPR and its president Mr. Tanagras, nothing seems strange—we have reached the point where offenders are found by mediums.

Such an achievement by Mrs. Zakynthinou—who, as readers recall, about three months earlier uncovered the perpetrators of a suitcase theft on the steamship “Kefallinia”—was certified yesterday before the Court of Appeal, where the appeal of one thief, Sigalas, was heard. He had been sentenced to five months. Sigalas yesterday confessed; Mr. A. Benetis, the victim, recounted how the medium, under hypnosis, said:

“The suitcase was opened on the ship Kefallinia during transfer. Two culprits. One is 25, ruddy blond. The other about 38, short, frail, named Giannis. They seem on the same watch. Time 2–3 a.m. I put the things in the smokestack. At 5 a.m. both left, took tram 20. At the last stop they headed toward Kretika. In a shack, pointed out yesterday by a young woman (the youth’s fiancée) and an old woman, they split the loot. Half went to short Giannis who headed to the Tabouria neighborhood.”

Based on this, both thieves were arrested; one later escaped. In court Mr. Tanagras gave a scientific explanation: Zakynthinou simply picked up the thoughts of the thieves, who were naturally thinking intensely about their act.

articles.title: Medium Uncovers Theft in Kymi - 1955
articles.author: Angelos Tanagras
articles.excerpt: An unprecedented case in Kymi, Evia: telepathic tuning with the medium "Sophia – Kassandra" revealed the thief, the stash, and his family link to the victim.

content.value: The GSPR received the following letter from the Kymi station of the Royal Gendarmerie about a theft solved by a medium.
ROYAL HELLENIC GENDARMERIE – Kymi Station
Kymi, 10 August 1955
Honorable Mr. Tanagras,

We hasten to inform you of the astonishing success of the medium belonging to your Society, currently in Kymi, named ‘SOPHIA – KASSANDRA’. Through its invaluable contribution it helped uncover the perpetrator of a theft in the village Oxilithos, about 15 km from the station.
This discovery was achieved thanks to its generous, spontaneous, and selfless cooperation with the gendarmerie to find the culprit.
Following the details given by the medium:
- description and location of the house where the theft occurred,
- the spot where the thief hid the loot (in a field near a mulberry tree, beside a stream and under a pile of stones),
- the thief’s name, Antonios, and the detail that he was related to the victim,
we discovered and arrested the culprit within hours; he fully confessed.

This stunning success, the detailed description of the theft as if reenacted, and above all the exact naming of the culprit impressed us. We hope future cooperation between your Society and law-enforcement will greatly benefit the public.
Commander of the Station, M. Grigorakos
The explanation lies in the medium Kassandra picking up the thief’s thoughts (telepathy). To achieve this, two conditions are needed:
- some similarity of organism between medium and thief,
- a similarity of psychic wavelength—like radio waves—so they can tune; without tuning thought-transfer is impossible.
Here Kassandra was tuned to the thief and received his thoughts like a switched-on radio. The stronger the medium, the more easily it tunes and receives thoughts.
In similar cases without tuning—like the ancient gap between the Pythia and Apollo—priests intervened with ambiguous oracles so the god would not seem false.
(Signed) ANGELOS TANAGRAS

articles.title: Eleni Kikidou - New GSPR Medium 1933
articles.author: Nik. Pap
articles.excerpt: The GSPR presents Miss Eleni Kikidou, a new medium succeeding in telepathy and clairvoyance experiments.

content.value: Beware of frauds posing as mediums—always ask the GSPR. Real mediums are first trained by the Society. A new medium: Miss Kikidou.

Inevitably, mediums attract exploitation by various swindlers who discovered there is money in it. Those who consult mediums rarely report what happens for fear of scandal, and thus harm the trust scientific mediums have earned.
For that reason, the scientific, accredited mediums formed the Association of Scientific Intuitive Mediums, which issued the following announcement:

‘The Association of Scientific Intuitives (mediums) warns the public about various fraudsters advertising themselves in newspapers with fanciful claims of finding secrets, curing diseases, etc., aiming to mislead the gullible.
The Association will act against such swindlers, notifying newspapers and police. Until further notice, for any medium, seek information from the GSPR (Tanagras’ residence).’

The work of the GSPR mediums concerns only telepathy, clairvoyance, and psychometry; only the first yields direct verification. Results of the other two should be treated as indications needing confirmation.
There are so many officially recognized mediums that frauds would have no place—if not for the impatient naïve who run to whomever they find without checking.
The Society, chaired by Mr. Tanagras, regularly publishes updates on its mediums and research. It also certifies new mediums—after tests that may last a year—so there is no need to create charlatans.

Today the Athens offices of the GSPR have about twenty capable mediums. Among them, just days ago, was added Miss Eleni Kikidou, a fair-haired girl with expressive blue eyes. For six months she took part without fail in the Society’s experiments and has now received permission for public appearances.

Miss Kikidou has successes in telepathy experiments and in clairvoyance tests. In these—where not all mediums succeed—the hypnotized medium identifies the contents of sealed envelopes. Mr. Tanagras explained how the tests are run:
A fixed set of envelopes is kept at GSPR headquarters, each containing a word, a name, a number, etc., wrapped in opaque paper.

One envelope is chosen at random and placed in the hands of the hypnotized medium, who presses it to forehead and chest and concentrates. Within under three minutes, the medium must find the exact content. How this works is still unknown—perhaps a kind of living X-ray, but conscious rays that, after piercing the envelope and reading its contents, return to alert the medium’s brain.
Eleni Kikidou, whose tests we have witnessed, scores about 80%—as did Maria Athanasopoulou six years ago, the first in Greece to produce psychometric phenomena.
At just 14, Kikidou also shows vivid post-hypnotic suggestion and notable success in the Athens–Germany telepathy trials with Professor Esterreich, as reported earlier in Akropolis.
Mr. Tanagras believes she is an exceptional medium.

articles.title: Eleni Kikidou - GSPR Experiments 1934
articles.excerpt: The GSPR showcased new telepathy, post-hypnotic suggestion, and psychometry experiments with Eleni Kikidou and other mediums.

content.value: New experiments of the GSPR – what Mr. Tanagras says.
At last Tuesday’s session, Angelos Tanagras ran experiments with GSPR mediums Kassandra, Eleni Zakynthinou, Elpida Pavlatou, and Eleni Kikidou.
They began with successful telepathy tests.
Tanagras hypnotized Kassandra, Pavlatou, and Zakynthinou, who executed thought-transference experiments successfully.

Visitors seated beside the mediums—without touching them—concentrated on images from their life, events, adventures of youth, or strong impressions. The mediums, in hypnosis, followed their thoughts and recited exactly what they were thinking.
Next came a post-hypnotic suggestion test with Miss Eleni Kikidou. Tanagras hypnotized her and seated her next to an imaginary metropolitan bishop.

The medium respectfully approached the empty chair, bowed, and asked the imaginary bishop to let her kiss his hand. At that moment Mr. Patriarcheas moved his own chair next to her; the medium was shocked at his ‘disrespect’ to the imaginary bishop and began crossing herself. Then Tanagras told her that the journalist writing this text was… her mother.

The medium turned and looked at me as I smoked, was startled, and started scolding her ‘mother’ for smoking in front of her father. The packet of cigarettes paid the price, as she deemed it proper to confiscate it so ‘mother’ would stop smoking!

Finally, the third phase: Misses Kassandra, Zakynthinou, and Pavlatou, under hypnosis, performed psychometry tests. A visitor handed them three identical cards; the mediums touched every surface, then the cards were subtly marked, mixed with others, and returned. After a few moments’ palpation—with eyes closed—the mediums picked out the cards they had touched initially.
Tanagras explains more:

‘The skin seems to leave on objects it touches a specific substance, invisible not only to the naked eye but under the microscope. This substance is likely immaterial since we cannot see its form. When the objects are returned to the mediums, they recognize the immaterial trace. Touch is not the issue—since all cards are identical in color and texture.’

articles.title: Revelations of Medium Zoe - 1933
articles.excerpt: Fourteen-year-old Zoe Voudouri, a powerful new medium, alarms spiritualist circles with successful predictions, telepathic tests, and political prophecies.

content.value: Spiritualism has spawned misconceptions. Some say there is no need for scientific explanations of spiritualist phenomena; others deny the reality of the experiments, attributing accuracy to tricks or frauds by mediums.
We do not think spiritualism depends on supernatural forces. All such phenomena are easily explained if we accept the intervention of conscious spirits producing them.
Spiritualism was known in antiquity. Modern spiritualism begins in 1841 with early psychic research in the United States.
Initially explained as supernatural, these phenomena were later disputed by psychophysiologists who, while accepting the observed facts, disagreed on interpretation.
They reject the existence and mediation of spirits, arguing the phenomena stem from emission of a vital force they call psychodynamism.
In Greece, research into psychic and spiritualist phenomena began at the turn of the century. In 1900 Mr. Tanagras and a group of scientists founded the GSPR.
Today the Society—representing spiritualist science in Greece—almost fully accepts hypnosis and telepathic phenomena.
It has progressed using people with highly developed suggestibility and hypnotic aptitude: the so-called mediums.
Lately a new, extraordinarily powerful medium has appeared on the Greek horizon: 14-year-old Zoe Voudouri, whose astonishing experiments have stirred psychic researchers.
She has been tested by many in the field and used in public psychical demonstrations. Mr. Tanagras certified her with these abilities:
1) hypnosis with heightened memory, 2) hypnotic and post-hypnotic suggestion, and 3) telepathy.
This remarkable medium is touring Greece and has been in our city for three days.
We met her at the Touriste hotel, where she stays with her father, Ch. Voudouris, and the hypnotist Mr. Morsy.
At first glance nothing betrays that this young girl possesses such ‘gifts.’
Unlike most mediums she is very fair; yet the pallor of her face and large, fixed eyes reveal the medium.
She recounts her life—how she was discovered—and even foretells future events.
Her gift was revealed under tragic circumstances: on Good Friday 1930 she announced her uncle’s death, confirmed the next day.
Her father brought her to Athens; in May 1931 Tanagras examined her at the University before professors and found an exceptional medium.
Her fame spread through cooperation with an Athenian newspaper and successful experiments, boosting its circulation by 3,000 copies.
Her greatest success: finding alive the mother of a young man who thought her dead—fully verified.
Zoe has predicted election results with complete accuracy and foretold the Plastiras revolt with details.
She also foretold the return of a lost dog within seven minutes—confirmed.
On politics she predicted the government would fall within a year and the death of a person in high office.
We part from the phenomenon hoping the second political prophecy does not come true.
Source: Neologos Patron, 12.05.1933
